content:
TITLE: Configuring Flask-SQLAlchemy with Application DESCRIPTION: Connects the Flask-SQLAlchemy extension to a Flask application instance. This example configures a SQLite database connection and initializes the extension with the app. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/quickstart.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` # create the app app = Flask(__name__) # configure the SQLite database, relative to the app instance folder app.config["SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI"] = "sqlite:///project.db" # initialize the app with the extension db.init_app(app) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Initializing Flask-SQLAlchemy Extension DESCRIPTION: Creates a SQLAlchemy object with a custom declarative base class. This is the first step in setting up Flask-SQLAlchemy in your application. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/quickstart.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from flask import Flask from flask_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemy from sqlalchemy.orm import DeclarativeBase class Base(DeclarativeBase): pass db = SQLAlchemy(model_class=Base) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Initializing and Using Flask-SQLAlchemy in Python DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to set up a Flask application with SQLAlchemy integration using Flask-SQLAlchemy. It shows database configuration, model definition, table creation, data insertion, and querying. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from flask import Flask from flask_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemy from sqlalchemy.orm import DeclarativeBase, Mapped, mapped_column app = Flask(__name__) app.config["SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI"] = "sqlite:///example.sqlite" class Base(DeclarativeBase): pass db = SQLAlchemy(app, model_class=Base) class User(db.Model): id: Mapped[int] = mapped_column(primary_key=True) username: Mapped[str] = mapped_column(unique=True) with app.app_context(): db.create_all() db.session.add(User(username="example")) db.session.commit() users = db.session.scalars(db.select(User)) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Database Tables with Flask-SQLAlchemy DESCRIPTION: Creates all database tables defined in your models. This operation requires an application context and should be run after all models are defined. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/quickstart.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` with app.app_context(): db.create_all() ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying Data with Flask-SQLAlchemy DESCRIPTION: Shows how to execute select queries using the modern SQLAlchemy syntax. The first example retrieves a single user by username, while the second example retrieves all users ordered by username. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/queries.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` user = db.session.execute(db.select(User).filter_by(username=username)).scalar_one() users = db.session.execute(db.select(User).order_by(User.username)).scalars() ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Inserting Data with Flask-SQLAlchemy DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to add a new user object to the database by adding it to the session and committing the changes. This is the standard pattern for inserting new records in Flask-SQLAlchemy. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/queries.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` user = User() db.session.add(user) db.session.commit() ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Example Connection Strings for Different Databases in Flask-SQLAlchemy DESCRIPTION: Provides example connection strings for SQLite, PostgreSQL, and MySQL/MariaDB databases. Shows the specific format for each database type, including how relative paths work with SQLite. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/config.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` # SQLite, relative to Flask instance path sqlite:///project.db # PostgreSQL postgresql://scott:tiger@localhost/project # MySQL / MariaDB mysql://scott:tiger@localhost/project ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Connection URL Format in Flask-SQLAlchemy DESCRIPTION: Shows the basic syntax for database connection URLs in Flask-SQLAlchemy. The format includes dialect, username, password, host, port, and database components, with some parts being optional depending on the database type. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/config.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` dialect://username:password@host:port/database ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Customizing the Model Class with a custom base and ID generation in Flask-SQLAlchemy DESCRIPTION: Creates a custom base class that automatically adds integer primary keys to all models, with foreign keys for joined-table inheritance. This example demonstrates how to pass a custom model class to the SQLAlchemy constructor. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/customizing.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from sqlalchemy import Integer, String, ForeignKey from sqlalchemy.orm import DeclarativeBase, Mapped, mapped_column, declared_attr class Base(DeclarativeBase): @declared_attr.cascading @classmethod def id(cls): for base in cls.__mro__[1:-1]: if getattr(base, "__table__", None) is not None: return mapped_column(ForeignKey(base.id), primary_key=True) else: return mapped_column(Integer, primary_key=True) db = SQLAlchemy(app, model_class=Base) class User(db.Model): name: Mapped[str] class Employee(User): title: Mapped[str] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Abstract Model Base Classes in Flask-SQLAlchemy DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to create an abstract model base class that adds timestamp functionality to specific models. The abstract class adds created and updated fields that are automatically set and updated with UTC timestamps. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/customizing.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from datetime import datetime, timezone from sqlalchemy.orm import Mapped, mapped_column class TimestampModel(db.Model): __abstract__ = True created: Mapped[datetime] = mapped_column(default=lambda: datetime.now(timezone.utc)) updated: Mapped[datetime] = mapped_column(default=lambda: datetime.now(timezone.utc), onupdate=lambda: datetime.now(timezone.utc)) class Author(db.Model): id: Mapped[int] = mapped_column(primary_key=True) username: Mapped[str] = mapped_column(unique=True) class Post(TimestampModel): id: Mapped[int] = mapped_column(primary_key=True) title: Mapped[str] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Mixins with Flask-SQLAlchemy Models DESCRIPTION: Shows how to implement a mixin class to add timestamp functionality to specific models instead of using an abstract base class. The mixin provides created and updated fields with automatic UTC timestamp handling. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/customizing.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` class TimestampMixin: created: Mapped[datetime] = mapped_column(default=lambda: datetime.now(timezone.utc)) updated: Mapped[datetime] = mapped_column(default=lambda: datetime.now(timezone.utc), onupdate=lambda: datetime.now(timezone.utc)) class Post(TimestampMixin, db.Model): id: Mapped[int] = mapped_column(primary_key=True) title: Mapped[str] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Custom Query Class in Flask-SQLAlchemy DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to create a custom query class that extends Flask-SQLAlchemy's Query with additional functionality. This example adds a get_or method that returns a default value when a record is not found. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/customizing.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from flask_sqlalchemy.query import Query class GetOrQuery(Query): def get_or(self, ident, default=None): out = self.get(ident) if out is None: return default return out db = SQLAlchemy(query_class=GetOrQuery) user = User.query.get_or(user_id, anonymous_user) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Tables with Binds in Flask-SQLAlchemy DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to create a table associated with a specific bind using the bind_key parameter in the Table constructor. The user_table is associated with the 'auth' bind. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/binds.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` user_table = db.Table( "user", db.Column("id", db.Integer, primary_key=True), bind_key="auth", ) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Flask Routes with SQLAlchemy Queries DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use Flask-SQLAlchemy in Flask routes to perform common database operations including listing, creating, viewing, and deleting users. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/quickstart.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` @app.route("/users") def user_list(): users = db.session.execute(db.select(User).order_by(User.username)).scalars() return render_template("user/list.html", users=users) @app.route("/users/create", methods=["GET", "POST"]) def user_create(): if request.method == "POST": user = User( username=request.form["username"], email=request.form["email"], ) db.session.add(user) db.session.commit() return redirect(url_for("user_detail", id=user.id)) return render_template("user/create.html") @app.route("/user/") def user_detail(id): user = db.get_or_404(User, id) return render_template("user/detail.html", user=user) @app.route("/user//delete", methods=["GET", "POST"]) def user_delete(id): user = db.get_or_404(User, id) if request.method == "POST": db.session.delete(user) db.session.commit() return redirect(url_for("user_list")) return render_template("user/delete.html", user=user) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating and Dropping Tables Across Multiple Binds in Flask-SQLAlchemy DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows various ways to create and drop tables across different binds using the create_all() and drop_all() methods. It demonstrates how to operate on all binds, specific binds, or a subset of binds. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/binds.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` # create tables for all binds db.create_all() # create tables for the default and "auth" binds db.create_all(bind_key=[None, "auth"]) # create tables for the "meta" bind db.create_all(bind_key="meta") # drop tables for the default bind db.drop_all(bind_key=None) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying Paginated Items in Jinja Template DESCRIPTION: Shows how to iterate through paginated items in a Jinja template. The page object can be iterated directly to access each item in the current page. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/pagination.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: jinja CODE: ```
    {% for user in page %}
  • {{ user.username }} {% endfor %}
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Custom Messages to 404 Errors in Flask-SQLAlchemy DESCRIPTION: Shows how to add a custom error message when using the one_or_404 query method. This provides more context in the 404 error page about why the resource wasn't found. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/queries.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` user = db.one_or_404( db.select(User).filter_by(username=username), description=f"No user named '{username}'." ) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a pytest Fixture for Flask-SQLAlchemy Application Context DESCRIPTION: This Python code defines a pytest fixture that provides an application context for tests. It also shows how to use the fixture in a test function to simplify context management. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/contexts.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` import pytest @pytest.fixture def app_ctx(app): with app.app_context(): yield @pytest.mark.usefixtures("app_ctx") def test_user_model(): user = User() db.session.add(user) db.session.commit() ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Managing Application Context in Flask-SQLAlchemy Tests DESCRIPTION: This Python test function shows how to use a manual application context in a test scenario. It demonstrates adding and committing a user to the database within the context. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/contexts.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` def test_user_model(app): user = User() with app.app_context(): db.session.add(user) db.session.commit() ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Flask-SQLAlchemy Query Methods for Views DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates specialized query methods for Flask views that automatically return 404 errors for missing entries. The examples show retrieving users by ID and username with proper error handling. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/queries.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` @app.route("/user-by-id/") def user_by_id(id): user = db.get_or_404(User, id) return render_template("show_user.html", user=user) @app.route("/user-by-username/") def user_by_username(username): user = db.one_or_404(db.select(User).filter_by(username=username)) return render_template("show_user.html", user=user) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Connecting to Model Commit Events in Flask-SQLAlchemy DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to connect a function to the 'models_committed' signal in Flask-SQLAlchemy. The connected function will receive a list of changes after each commit operation. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/track-modifications.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from flask_sqlalchemy.track_modifications import models_committed def get_modifications(sender: Flask, changes: list[tuple[t.Any, str]]) -> None: ... models_committed.connect(get_modifications) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving Recorded Queries in Flask-SQLAlchemy DESCRIPTION: Use the get_recorded_queries function to retrieve a list of query info objects. Each object contains detailed information about executed SQL queries, including the SQL statement, parameters, execution time, and location in the code. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/record-queries.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from flask_sqlalchemy import get_recorded_queries recorded_queries = get_recorded_queries() ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Custom MetaData with Naming Conventions DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to initialize SQLAlchemy with custom metadata configuration and naming conventions for database constraints. This helps maintain consistent constraint names across database migrations. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/legacy-quickstart.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from sqlalchemy import MetaData from flask_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemy db = SQLAlchemy(metadata=MetaData(naming_convention={ "ix": 'ix_%(column_0_label)s', "uq": "uq_%(table_name)s_%(column_0_name)s", "ck": "ck_%(table_name)s_%(constraint_name)s", "fk": "fk_%(table_name)s_%(column_0_name)s_%(referred_table_name)s", "pk": "pk_%(table_name)s" })) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Initializing Flask-SQLAlchemy Extension DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create the basic SQLAlchemy database instance for Flask applications using the legacy 1.x API. Creates a db object that will serve as the entry point for database operations. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/legacy-quickstart.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from flask import Flask from flask_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemy from sqlalchemy.orm import DeclarativeBase db = SQLAlchemy() ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Model Query Helper Methods DESCRIPTION: Shows the new model query helper methods added in version 3.0+ for 404 handling and pagination. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/CHANGES.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` model = db.get_or_404(Model, id) first_item = db.first_or_404(select(Model)) one_item = db.one_or_404(select(Model)) pagination = db.paginate(select(Model)) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining SQLAlchemy Models with Type Annotations DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to define a SQLAlchemy model class with type annotations. The model creates a database table with columns for id, username, and email. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/quickstart.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from sqlalchemy import Integer, String from sqlalchemy.orm import Mapped, mapped_column class User(db.Model): id: Mapped[int] = mapped_column(primary_key=True) username: Mapped[str] = mapped_column(unique=True) email: Mapped[str] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Database URI Configuration Example DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the format for configuring database URI and binds in Flask-SQLAlchemy 3.0+. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/CHANGES.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI = "sqlite:///file:name.db?uri=true" SQLALCHEMY_BINDS = { "bind_key": { "url": "sqlite:///other.db", "engine_opts": {} } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Referencing Python Code Properties DESCRIPTION: Code property references mentioned throughout the changelog, including `__tablename__`, `declarative_base()`, `SQLAlchemy.__init__`, `DeclarativeMeta`, and other core Flask-SQLAlchemy components. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/CHANGES.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` __tablename__ declarative_base() SQLAlchemy.__init__ DeclarativeMeta _BoundDeclarativeMeta DefaultMeta query_class model_class db.session __bind_key__ SQLALCHEMY_ECHO SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI declared_attr MetaData SignallingSession BaseQuery db.Query db.relation db.relationship db.dynamic_loader db.Table ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Customizing Session Query Class in Flask-SQLAlchemy DESCRIPTION: Shows how to customize only the session.query interface by passing the query_cls key to the session_options argument in the SQLAlchemy constructor. This affects only queries created via the session. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/customizing.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` db = SQLAlchemy(session_options={"query_cls": GetOrQuery}) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disabling Table Name Generation in Flask-SQLAlchemy DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to disable Flask-SQLAlchemy's automatic table name generation by setting the disable_autonaming parameter to True in the SQLAlchemy constructor, requiring explicit table name declaration for all models. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/customizing.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` class Base(sa_orm.DeclarativeBase): pass db = SQLAlchemy(app, model_class=Base, disable_autonaming=True) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying RuntimeError for Missing Application Context in Flask-SQLAlchemy DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the error message that occurs when trying to use the database without an active application context. It explains the typical cause and suggests a solution using app.app_context(). SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/contexts.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` RuntimeError: Working outside of application context. This typically means that you attempted to use functionality that needed the current application. To solve this, set up an application context with app.app_context(). See the documentation for more information. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating Data with Flask-SQLAlchemy DESCRIPTION: Shows how to update an existing user record by modifying its attributes and committing the changes. The session tracks the modifications to the object and translates them to SQL updates. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/queries.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` user.verified = True db.session.commit() ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Example of Pagination.iter_pages() Output DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the output of the iter_pages() method on a Pagination object. This example shows the page numbers that would be yielded for a dataset with 20 pages when the current page is 7. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/pagination.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` users.iter_pages() [1, 2, None, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, 11, None, 19, 20] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Flask-SQLAlchemy Development Dependencies DESCRIPTION: Commands to install the development dependencies and Flask-SQLAlchemy in editable mode. This setup allows you to modify the code and immediately see the effects without reinstalling. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` $ pip install -r requirements/dev.txt && pip install -e . ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running the Full Test Suite for Flask-SQLAlchemy with Tox DESCRIPTION: Command to run the full test suite in parallel using tox. This tests against all supported environments and configurations. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` $ tox p ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Cloning the Flask-SQLAlchemy Repository for Development DESCRIPTION: Commands to clone the Flask-SQLAlchemy repository to your local machine after forking it. This creates a local copy to work with for development. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` $ git clone https://github.com/{username}/flask-sqlalchemy $ cd flask-sqlalchemy ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Python Virtual Environment for Flask-SQLAlchemy Development DESCRIPTION: Commands to create and activate a Python virtual environment for Flask-SQLAlchemy development on Unix/Linux systems. This isolates the development dependencies from the system Python installation. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` $ python3 -m venv .venv $ . .venv/bin/activate ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining SQLAlchemy Model Class DESCRIPTION: Shows how to define a SQLAlchemy model class using the db.Model base class. Creates a User model with id, username, and email fields with appropriate constraints. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/legacy-quickstart.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` class User(db.Model): id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True) username = db.Column(db.String, unique=True, nullable=False) email = db.Column(db.String) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Activating Python Virtual Environment on Windows for Flask-SQLAlchemy DESCRIPTION: Command to activate a Python virtual environment on Windows systems for Flask-SQLAlchemy development. Windows uses a different activation script compared to Unix/Linux systems. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` > .venv\Scripts\activate ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Git with User Information for Flask-SQLAlchemy Development DESCRIPTION: Commands to configure Git with username and email prior to contributing to Flask-SQLAlchemy. These settings are essential for proper attribution of commits in the project history. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` $ git config --global user.name 'your name' $ git config --global user.email 'your email' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Branch for Bug or Documentation Fixes in Flask-SQLAlchemy DESCRIPTION: Git commands to create a new branch from the latest release branch for bug or documentation fixes. This ensures your changes are based on the appropriate version for backporting. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` $ git fetch origin $ git checkout -b your-branch-name origin/3.0.x ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Branch for Feature Additions in Flask-SQLAlchemy DESCRIPTION: Git commands to create a new branch from the main branch for feature additions or changes. New features should be developed against the main development branch. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` $ git fetch origin $ git checkout -b your-branch-name origin/main ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Committing Release Version for Flask-SQLAlchemy DESCRIPTION: Git command to commit the release version changes with a standard message. This records the version update in the repository history. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` $ git commit -am 'release version A.B.C' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Multiple Database Binds in Flask-SQLAlchemy DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to configure multiple database connections using the SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI for the default connection and SQLALCHEMY_BINDS for additional connections. It shows how to specify different database types and engine options. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/binds.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI = "postgresql:///main" SQLALCHEMY_BINDS = { "meta": "sqlite:////path/to/meta.db", "auth": { "url": "mysql://localhost/users", "pool_recycle": 3600, }, } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating and Pushing a Release Tag for Flask-SQLAlchemy DESCRIPTION: Git commands to create an annotated tag for the release and push it to the repository. This marks the specific commit that represents the release. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` $ git tag -am 'release version A.B.C' A.B.C $ git push origin A.B.C ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Cloning and Preparing the Flask-SQLAlchemy Repository DESCRIPTION: Commands for cloning the Flask-SQLAlchemy repository and navigating to the Flaskr example directory. Includes checkout to the correct version tag to ensure compatibility with documentation. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/examples/flaskr/README.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` # clone the repository $ git clone https://github.com/pallets/flask-sqlalchemy $ cd flask-sqlalchemy/examples/flaskr # checkout the correct version $ git checkout correct-version-tag ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Python Virtual Environment on Unix-like Systems DESCRIPTION: Commands for creating and activating a Python virtual environment on Unix-like systems. This isolates the project dependencies from the system Python installation. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/examples/flaskr/README.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` $ python3 -m venv venv $ . venv/bin/activate ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Python Virtual Environment on Windows DESCRIPTION: Commands for creating and activating a Python virtual environment on Windows command prompt. This isolates the project dependencies from the system Python installation. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/examples/flaskr/README.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` $ py -3 -m venv venv $ venv\Scripts\activate.bat ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing from Main Branch with Source Dependencies DESCRIPTION: Commands for installing Flask-SQLAlchemy from source and the Flaskr application when using the main branch. This ensures you're using the latest development version of Flask-SQLAlchemy. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/examples/flaskr/README.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` $ pip install -e ../.. $ pip install -e . ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Pagination Query in Flask-SQLAlchemy DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the paginate method on a database select statement to get a Pagination object. This example shows querying a list of users ordered by join date and passing the pagination object to a template. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/pagination.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` page = db.paginate(db.select(User).order_by(User.join_date)) return render_template("user/list.html", page=page) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Flaskr Application on Unix-like Systems DESCRIPTION: Commands for setting up environment variables, initializing the database, and running the Flaskr application on Unix-like systems. FLASK_ENV=development enables development features like interactive debugger. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/examples/flaskr/README.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` $ export FLASK_APP=flaskr $ export FLASK_ENV=development $ flask init-db $ flask run ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Tests with Coverage Reporting DESCRIPTION: Commands for running tests with coverage analysis and generating reports. Includes commands for console output and HTML report generation for detailed coverage inspection. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/examples/flaskr/README.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` $ coverage run -m pytest $ coverage report $ coverage html # open htmlcov/index.html in a browser ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Pip Dependencies Configuration DESCRIPTION: A pip-compile generated requirements file that specifies exact versions of Python packages needed for development and testing. Includes type checking tools (mypy, pyright), testing framework (pytest), and their dependencies. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/requirements/typing.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: pip CODE: ``` iniconfig==2.0.0 # via pytest mypy==1.13.0 # via -r typing.in mypy-extensions==1.0.0 # via mypy nodeenv==1.9.1 # via pyright packaging==24.1 # via pytest pluggly==1.5.0 # via pytest pyright==1.1.386 # via -r typing.in pytest==8.3.3 # via -r typing.in typing-extensions==4.12.2 # via # mypy # pyright ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying Flask-SQLAlchemy Title Image in reStructuredText DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to include and align the Flask-SQLAlchemy title image in the documentation using reStructuredText syntax. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/index.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: rst CODE: ``` .. image:: _static/flask-sqlalchemy-title.png :align: center ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Table of Contents for User Guide in reStructuredText DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to create a table of contents for the User Guide section using reStructuredText directives. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/index.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: rst CODE: ``` .. toctree:: :maxdepth: 2 quickstart config models queries pagination contexts binds record-queries track-modifications customizing ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Pagination with Flask-SQLAlchemy DESCRIPTION: Example of using the paginate() method to handle pagination in Flask-SQLAlchemy. This creates a Pagination object that can be passed to a template. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/legacy-query.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` page = User.query.order_by(User.join_date).paginate() return render_template("user/list.html", page=page) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Table of Contents for API Reference in reStructuredText DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to create a table of contents for the API Reference section using reStructuredText directives. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/index.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: rst CODE: ``` .. toctree:: :maxdepth: 2 api ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Table of Contents for Additional Information in reStructuredText DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to create a table of contents for the Additional Information section using reStructuredText directives. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/index.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: rst CODE: ``` .. toctree:: :maxdepth: 2 license changes ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Models with Binds in Flask-SQLAlchemy DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to associate a model with a specific database bind by setting the __bind_key__ class attribute. In this case, the User model is associated with the 'auth' bind. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/binds.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` class User(db.Model): __bind_key__ = "auth" id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Performing Basic Queries with Flask-SQLAlchemy Legacy Interface DESCRIPTION: Examples of basic queries using the legacy query interface in Flask-SQLAlchemy. Shows how to get a user by ID and by username. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/legacy-query.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` # get the user with id 5 user = User.query.get(5) # get a user by username user = User.query.filter_by(username=username).one() ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deleting Data with Flask-SQLAlchemy DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to delete a user record from the database by passing the object to the session's delete method and committing the changes. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/queries.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` db.session.delete(user) db.session.commit() ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Database Tables with Manual Application Context in Flask-SQLAlchemy DESCRIPTION: This Python function demonstrates how to create a Flask application, configure it, import models, and create database tables using db.create_all() within a manually pushed application context. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/contexts.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` def create_app(): app = Flask(__name__) app.config.from_object("project.config") import project.models with app.app_context(): db.create_all() return app ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Database Tables DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to create all defined database tables within a Flask application context using the create_all() method. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/legacy-quickstart.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` with app.app_context(): db.create_all() ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Customizing the Session Class in Flask-SQLAlchemy DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create and use a custom session class that extends both ShardedSession and Flask-SQLAlchemy's Session. This enables implementing custom session behavior such as horizontal sharding. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/customizing.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from sqlalchemy.ext.horizontal_shard import ShardedSession from flask_sqlalchemy.session import Session class CustomSession(ShardedSession, Session): ... db = SQLAlchemy(session_options={"class_": CustomSession}) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using 404 Helper Methods in Flask-SQLAlchemy Views DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use one_or_404() in a Flask view function to raise a 404 error if a user doesn't exist with the specified username. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/legacy-query.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` @app.route("/user/") def show_user(username): user = User.query.filter_by(username=username).one_or_404() return render_template("show_user.html", user=user) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Customizing Query Class for Specific Models in Flask-SQLAlchemy DESCRIPTION: Shows how to customize the query interface for a specific model by setting the query_class attribute on the model class. This applies the custom query behavior only to that model. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/customizing.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` class User(db.Model): query_class = GetOrQuery ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Rendering Pagination Widget in Jinja DESCRIPTION: A Jinja macro that renders a pagination widget with navigation links. It displays the current range of items, total count, and generates links to other pages while highlighting the current page. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/pagination.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: jinja CODE: ``` {% macro render_pagination(pagination, endpoint) %}
{{ pagination.first }} - {{ pagination.last }} of {{ pagination.total }}
{% for page in pagination.iter_pages() %} {% if page %} {% if page != pagination.page %} {{ page }} {% else %} {{ page }} {% endif %} {% else %} â€¦ {% endif %} {% endfor %}
{% endmacro %} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Custom Messages to 404 Errors in Flask-SQLAlchemy DESCRIPTION: Shows how to add a custom message to a 404 error when using one_or_404() in Flask-SQLAlchemy. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/legacy-query.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` user = User.query.filter_by(username=username).one_or_404( description=f"No user named '{username}'." ) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Query Recording in Flask-SQLAlchemy Configuration DESCRIPTION: To enable query recording in Flask-SQLAlchemy, set the SQLALCHEMY_RECORD_QUERIES configuration option to True in the Flask app config. This allows for debugging and performance analysis of SQL queries. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/record-queries.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` app.config['SQLALCHEMY_RECORD_QUERIES'] = True ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Customizing Query Class for Dynamic Relationships in Flask-SQLAlchemy DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to customize the query interface for a specific dynamic relationship by passing the query_class argument to the relationship function. This provides custom query behavior for that relationship only. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/customizing.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` db.relationship(User, lazy="dynamic", query_class=GetOrQuery) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Version Check Python Import Example DESCRIPTION: Shows the recommended way to check Flask-SQLAlchemy version using importlib.metadata instead of the deprecated __version__ attribute. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/CHANGES.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from importlib.metadata import version flask_sqlalchemy_version = version("flask-sqlalchemy") ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Flask-SQLAlchemy with pip DESCRIPTION: Command to install or update Flask-SQLAlchemy using pip. This installs the latest version of the extension from PyPI. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/quickstart.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` $ pip install -U Flask-SQLAlchemy ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Flaskr Application on Windows DESCRIPTION: Commands for setting up environment variables, initializing the database, and running the Flaskr application on Windows command prompt. Uses 'set' instead of 'export' for environment variables. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/examples/flaskr/README.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` > set FLASK_APP=flaskr > set FLASK_ENV=development > flask init-db > flask run ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Flaskr Application DESCRIPTION: Command for installing the Flaskr application in development mode. The -e flag installs the package in editable mode, allowing changes to be immediately reflected without reinstallation. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/examples/flaskr/README.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` $ pip install -e . ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing and Running Tests for Flaskr DESCRIPTION: Commands for installing test dependencies and running the test suite with pytest. The [test] extra installs all required testing dependencies. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/examples/flaskr/README.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` $ pip install -e '.[test]' $ python3 -m pytest ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Basic Tests for Flask-SQLAlchemy with Pytest DESCRIPTION: Command to run the basic test suite using pytest. This verifies that your changes don't break existing functionality. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` $ pytest ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Test Coverage for Flask-SQLAlchemy DESCRIPTION: Commands to collect coverage information and generate a coverage report. This helps identify code that needs additional testing. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` $ pip install "coverage[toml]" $ coverage run -m pytest $ coverage html ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Pre-commit Hooks for Flask-SQLAlchemy Development DESCRIPTION: Command to install pre-commit hooks that automatically run code formatters and linters before each commit. This ensures code quality and consistency across contributions. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` $ pre-commit install ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Building Documentation for Flask-SQLAlchemy DESCRIPTION: Commands to build the documentation using Sphinx. This converts the reStructuredText files into HTML for viewing in a browser. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` $ cd docs $ make html ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Including Changes File in RST Documentation DESCRIPTION: A reStructuredText directive that includes the contents of the CHANGES.rst file from the parent directory into the current document. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/changes.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: rst CODE: ``` .. include:: ../CHANGES.rst ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Pushing Changes and Creating a Pull Request for Flask-SQLAlchemy DESCRIPTION: Command to push your local branch to your fork on GitHub before creating a pull request. This uploads your changes to GitHub so they can be reviewed and merged. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` $ git push --set-upstream fork your-branch-name ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Test Dependencies for Flask-SQLAlchemy with pip-compile DESCRIPTION: This pip-compiled file specifies the exact versions of test dependencies for the Flask-SQLAlchemy project. It includes pytest and its required packages, ensuring consistent testing environments. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/requirements/tests.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: pip CODE: ``` # # This file is autogenerated by pip-compile with Python 3.13 # by the following command: # # pip-compile tests.in # iniconfig==2.0.0 # via pytest packaging==24.1 # via pytest pluggy==1.5.0 # via pytest pytest==8.3.3 # via -r tests.in ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Release Branch for Flask-SQLAlchemy DESCRIPTION: Command to create a release branch for preparing a new release. Release branches are used to isolate release preparation from ongoing development. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` $ git switch -c release-A.B.C A.B.x ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Generating pip requirements for Flask-SQLAlchemy documentation DESCRIPTION: This is a pip-compiled requirements file created from docs.in that lists all the dependencies needed for building Flask-SQLAlchemy documentation. It includes Sphinx, Pallets themes, and various Sphinx extensions along with all their dependencies at specific versions. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/requirements/docs.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: pip CODE: ``` # # This file is autogenerated by pip-compile with Python 3.13 # by the following command: # # pip-compile docs.in # alabaster==1.0.0 # via sphinx babel==2.16.0 # via sphinx certifi==2024.8.30 # via requests charset-normalizer==3.4.0 # via requests docutils==0.21.2 # via sphinx idna==3.10 # via requests imagesize==1.4.1 # via sphinx jinja2==3.1.4 # via sphinx markupsafe==3.0.2 # via jinja2 packaging==24.1 # via # pallets-sphinx-themes # sphinx pallets-sphinx-themes==2.3.0 # via -r docs.in pygments==2.18.0 # via sphinx requests==2.32.3 # via sphinx snowballstemmer==2.2.0 # via sphinx sphinx==8.1.3 # via # -r docs.in # pallets-sphinx-themes # sphinx-notfound-page # sphinxcontrib-log-cabinet sphinx-notfound-page==1.0.4 # via pallets-sphinx-themes sphinxcontrib-applehelp==2.0.0 # via sphinx sphinxcontrib-devhelp==2.0.0 # via sphinx sphinxcontrib-htmlhelp==2.1.0 # via sphinx sphinxcontrib-jsmath==1.0.1 # via sphinx sphinxcontrib-log-cabinet==1.0.1 # via -r docs.in sphinxcontrib-qthelp==2.0.0 # via sphinx sphinxcontrib-serializinghtml==2.0.0 # via sphinx urllib3==2.2.3 # via requests ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Merging a Fix Release Branch into Main for Flask-SQLAlchemy DESCRIPTION: Git commands to merge a fix release branch back into the main branch after a release. This ensures that all fixes are incorporated into future development. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` $ git switch A.B.x $ git pull $ git switch main $ git merge A.B.x $ git push ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Generating pip-compiled Requirements with pip-compile DESCRIPTION: Command used to generate the requirements file from dev.in input file using pip-compile with Python 3.13. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/requirements/dev.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` pip-compile dev.in ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a New Fix Release Branch after a Feature Release DESCRIPTION: Git commands to create a new branch for fix releases after a feature release. This branch will be used for any future bug fixes to the feature release. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_17 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` $ git switch main $ git pull $ git switch -c A.B.x $ git push ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Pip-compile Generated Requirements for Flask-SQLAlchemy Build Dependencies DESCRIPTION: This is an automatically generated pip requirements file created by running pip-compile on build.in. It specifies the exact versions of build (1.2.2.post1), packaging (24.1), and pyproject-hooks (1.2.0) needed for building the Flask-SQLAlchemy project. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/requirements/build.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: pip CODE: ``` build==1.2.2.post1 # via -r build.in packaging==24.1 # via build pyproject-hooks==1.2.0 # via build ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Including BSD-3-Clause License Text in reStructuredText DESCRIPTION: This snippet uses the 'literalinclude' directive to embed the contents of the LICENSE.txt file into the document. The 'language' option is set to 'text' to ensure proper formatting of the license text. SOURCE: https://github.com/pallets-eco/flask-sqlalchemy/blob/main/docs/license.rst#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: reStructuredText CODE: ``` .. literalinclude:: ../LICENSE.txt :language: text ```
